alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued October 16 at 5:13PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY... An Air Pollution Advisory, issued by the Oregon Department of Environmental Quality this past Friday, remains in effect until 11 AM PDT Monday. Smoke from the Cedar Creek Fire in Willamette National Forest has thinned such Air Quality is Moderate this afternoon across Douglas County, likely due higher humidity associated with an air mass that`s pushed in from the Pacific Ocean. Tonight into Monday morning air quality is likely to be mostly Good to Moderate across Douglas County, but could fall into the Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups range in some areas, mainly east and northeast of Roseburg. If you are easily negatively affected by wildfire smoke, continue to take precautions. The Air Quality Alert will be reassessed Monday morning. For additional information...please visit the web site at http://www.oregon.gov/deq
